title: Operations with Like Radicals
text: When radicals are like, we subtract or add the coefficients depending on the operation. For example, $$4\sqrt{3}+5\sqrt{3}$$ $$=$$ $$\left(4+5\right) \sqrt{3}$$ $$=$$ $$9\sqrt{3}$$.
speech: When radicals are like, we subtract or add the coefficients depending on the operation. For example,  4 the square root of 3 plus, 5 the square root of 3   is equal to   parentheses 4 plus 5,  times the square root of 3   is equal to,  , 9 the square root of 3 .
pacedSpeech: When radicals are like, we subtract or add the coefficients depending on the operation. For example,   4 the square root of 3 plus, 5 the square root of 3
4 plus 5,  times the square root of 3

title: Operations without Like Radicals
text: When radicals are not like, we cannot add or subtract them. We leave the expression as is.
speech: When radicals are not like, we cannot add or subtract them. We leave the expression as is.
pacedSpeech: When radicals are not like, we cannot add or subtract them. We leave the expression as is.
